Stayed one night
review_text:
This is one of the first Airbnbs I have stayed in that was actually better than the pictures! The space was beautiful. Everything was squeaky clean and the bed was so cozy.
The neighborhood was very walkable and the apartment was close to a ton of cafes, restaurants, and stores. There was ample street parking nearby.
Overall, staying here was a very zen, clean, and cozy experience.

name: Tara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: The place was awesome- looked just like the photos, fully stocked with everything you’d need for a little getaway. Tons of extra towels and linens which is always appreciated. The location was fantastic- walking distance to everything in Hudson! Such a cute town. One thing to note- the place sleeps 3 people, not 4 like it lists. There is a bed (sleeps 2) and a couch (sleeps 1- does not pull out) so keep in mind when booking. Additionally, there was zero flexibility in terms of early check in/late check out. We stayed one night and were hoping the place could accommodate our bags while we walked around/before we caught our Amtrak back to the city. Since they would not do it, we ended up paying $25/hour for the convenience. I’ve never heard of anything like this and was honestly pretty annoyed they wouldn’t work with us without charging us extra. All in all it was a nice experience and a good place- just keep in mind when booking!

name: Melissa
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
The good stuff -
The checkin and checkout process was seamless and quick! The host and his partner was very on top of the details, quick to respond and very accommodating. The place was immaculately cleaned and exactly what you expect from the pictures, if not even better in person. I was surprised at how much bigger it was in person! The price was very good compared to hotels in the area the same weekend. Definitely worth it!
The not so good stuff -
I didn’t love the location which felt to me like a bit of sketchy area and this apartment is on the ground floor. I don’t know much about Hudson NY but explore that a bit before booking. There was a loud disturbance outside of the home at night that was unsettling but it could have been just a case of bad luck. One other thing, on the second day in the morning, I could hear everything from the upstairs apartment from the bedroom like steps, movement, etc. It wasn’t an issue and was faint, but worth mentioning.

We thought the bed was very comfortable, and the place was welcoming and homey. The first night we stayed there were some guests above us who had a small child. Because this is an older home of frame construction, and not a newer steel and concrete building, we could hear him running above us. This was only an issue in the early morning of the first day. Despite that, I would stay there again.

review_text:
My husband and I were traveling for a conference I was running in Hudson at the Hudson Hall. The location of Claudia's place is perfect. Just a few blocks and you're on Warren street. We were super comfortable during our stay. We felt right at home. The kitchen has everything you need, there is a nice large table where my husband and I could spread out and work. Separate living space to chill and chat or catch up on some news. The backyard is so cute and quaint. We felt safe. It was a great home base for our stay in Hudson.
I had a few questions and Claudia is responsive, quite funny, and I believe we'd be friends if I lived nearby!
We've stayed in a lot of Airbnbs and Claudia's place is in the top of the list. Sorry Claudia, you're beaten by a Glamping experience in Colorado which is not really apples to apples.
Thank you for sharing your amazing place with us!!
Nicole

review_text:
We had an incredible experience staying at this beautiful home in Hudson, NY. It was simply amazing, with its charming decor and cozy atmosphere that made us feel right at home. The hosts were so warm and welcoming, ensuring every detail was taken care of during my stay.
Hudson itself is a delightful town with so much character and history. I loved strolling through the streets, admiring the beautiful architecture, and experiencing the local culture. The food scene in Hudson is beyond impressive – the diverse restaurants offered a wide range of delicious cuisines, and I couldn't get enough of the delectable dishes.
Overall, my stay in Hudson was an unforgettable experience, and I can't wait to return to this lovely town and the Airbnb that made it even more special. Highly recommended!

review_text:
Style and comfort abound, which is why I keep coming back to Claudia’s charming State St pied-à-terre. Well, that and her proximity to my goddaughter’s home as well as everything happening in between and on Warren St.
The Maker Lounge was a newly added stop this trip, but equally enjoyable was an impromptu pizza (Boba Louie’s) picnic in Claudia’s charming garden.
Sheets and towels, as well as rooms, are pristine. At your fingertips is a well-appointed kitchen down to the coffee press. Books and paintings enhance cleverly crafted interiors designed to fill the senses—everything needed to be transported “upstate.” ❤️

name: Houman
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
March 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Temperature locked by host at 62 degrees at night and 69 during the day. I had a bad cold and bed-ridden and Explained this to her and asked her to change it to 72 degrees for me, she begrudgingly did for a few hours saying that I would “roast” the neighbors upstairs and downstairs. However at night it went back to 62 degrees and I barely slept and got even sicker. She defended the fact that the thermostat is locked with a pin and set at 62, in the dead of winter (was 28 degrees outside).

name: Ellen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Claudia's place is extremely welcoming and comfortable! It served as the perfect location to relax, recharge and reconnect.
The apartment is on the main level of an older house. From the street, there are about 10 steps up to the entrance. From the back door it can be accessed on ground level. There is a nice yard and designated parking spot behind the house, which unfortunately was occupied during my visit so I parked on State St. Alternate side parking is enforced but I could find no indication as to when one must move the car. (Does everyone rush out at midnight? Is there a window?) Despite fair warning I got a $15 ticket...my fault.
The apartment has 3 spacious rooms, a kitchen, and small bathroom with shower/tub. It was nice to be able to heat up some food we brought and assemble light meals. The kitchen had all the necessary utensils and items, including a fridge and gas stove. No microwave however.
The bedroom is quiet - it faces the back - and the large bed is very comfy. I slept well there! Note, there is nowhere to hang up any clothing but there are chairs and a long bench in the bedroom to lay out folded items.
Visitors should be aware that the house and neighborhood are quite old. The floorboards are creaky; here and there are even some gaps. Someone lives in the flat below so please be considerate, keep tv and voices low. Slippers are recommended due to the old floors. The house is also kept fairly cool so do bring a sweater if visiting in winter.
This is the nicest house on the block; others range from decent to fairly ramshackle. However, the neighborhood seems safe. Do not expect to see the stately brick mansions of Warren St., but if you are looking for comfortable, clean lodgings you will be delighted with Claudia's apartment. Most importantly, she was always available to answer any questions promptly throughout my stay (though out of town herself) and all her communication was extremely cordial.
I could not have had a nicer experience and recommend this location wholeheartedly!

It is a 10-15 minute walk to the train station and the Basilica, and a 5 minute walk to Warren Street--a street of some long blocks of restaurants, antique stores, and clothing stores. Do know that Hudson is making a comeback and, if you are needing this, is not fully gentrified. This property is clearly attended to and highly maintained. But the location of this house--like much of the little town-- is mixed with homes that are not kept up. But don't let that deter you. We walked late at night around the town comfortably. We recommend this listing highly.

We lucked out and got perfect weather for the weekend so we were able to walk to Warren street and enjoy delicious meals at Hudson Food Studio, Swoon and Crimson Sparrow, cocktails at Fish and Game and coffee at Moto. Great shopping to be had on Warren St. as well including at the cute new boutique Collective 23.

We arrived after dark, and not only did she leave the light on for us, but the heat was on, so the apartment felt very welcoming after a long drive. An email arrived not too long after we did, checking to make sure that everything was in order.

The apartment is very homey, and a nice size for the 3 of us- cosy, but plenty of room to spread out. The furnishings are eclectic- the overall feel is a bit early attic (in a good way). Lots of interesting bits and pieces, but not cluttered. The current table and chairs in the dining room are different (and I think nicer) than the white set in current picture.

We did have one small problem with the stove, and it was fixed within an hour. Location is very handy- a short walk to the main drag in Hudson. We would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
My sister and I stayed here mid-week, so we didn't get to meet Claudia. However, she was very responsive to emails and texts. She even texted me to check in on how we were doing during our 2-night stay.

We were pleased to find an affordable, pet-friendly option that was walking distance from town. Like the rest of the reviews, we found the apartment to be clean and comfortable, with convenient parking.

The house is a standout on the block -- the rest of the places on this street seemed quite run-down. While we never felt unsafe, it was a bit of a surprise relative to the luxury of Warren Street.

The bathroom, while clean, is quite small.

One thing to note about Hudson that was not specific to this apartment: the town is mostly closed Tues-Thurs. We found most of the stores and restaurants were not open during the days we were there. I'm sure it is much more lively on the weekends.

It's like a cottage in the city. Literally. The dining room is so charming. If I were staying longer and had friends to invite over in the area, this would be the perfect place to host a farm-to-table dinner. Claudia is a gracious host. She makes it all very easy. No fuss no muss. A pleasure as always!

There is a driveway to park in, a nice backyard with seating, and a huge and comfortable king size bed. This place was definitely worth staying in, and I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in Hudson by themselves or with a friend.

We has a fantastic stay at Claudia's house in Hudson, NY. The house is 2 blocks from the main street (Warren), in a quiet part of town, making it ideal for exploring the boutiques and restaurants.
Apartment # 2 on the main floor is spacious and well-appointed. We were very grateful for the small touches such as coffee in the cupboard to help us jumpstart the day with a toddler.
Claudia was, without reservation, the best host. She was not intrusive, left us detailed and easy-to-follow instructions, and plenty of recommendations. She also allowed us to stay all day on the check-out day when she found that the housekeeper is not coming until next day.
I highly recommend Claudia's property for vacationing in Hudson.

Everything about the apartment was as stated. it was very comfortable and convenient to everything in the town. The place was clean and had all the amenities one could want for a short (three day) stay and more.
The neighborhood borders a pretty run-down area. As Claudia warned us Hudson is "in transition." That was a bit of shock at first but I always felt safe and we walked all over. The main drag is the opposite pretty much, full of opulent businesses and fine restaurants.
I highly recommend 32 State Street!

When we couldn't initially get on the wifi, Claudia quickly responded with an effective solution. We appreciated the staples she had on hand in the kitchen for tea, coffee, and cooking. We had really excellent dinner at Swoon Kitchenbar, brunch at Cafe Le Perche, coffee at Rev, and lunch at Baba Louie's. Our visit was during a cold January weekend so we drove a lot and appreciated the parking spot in back of the apt, but in warmer weather we could have easily walked from the apt. to Warren Street where most of the shops and restaurants are.

review_text:
We had a delightful get away to the town of Hudson and were so pleased with our stay at 320 State Street. Claudia contacted us a few days prior to our stay with all the information we needed and once we arrived there was a welcome book with information on Hudson, the house information (internet code/TV info, etc) and reccomendations for restaurants and activities. I have never done a booking on Airbnb before and was a bit nervous. I have to say- the pictures do not lie! The house is spacious and beautifully appointed with rustic repurposed furniture. The bedroom is so large with lots of closet space, and some nice benches to put your luggage. Claudia left coffee, milk, eggs in the fridge for breakfast and there is full cooking equipment, plates, glasses, etc and spices if you want to pick up groceries and enjoy a meal in.
It is such a nice place to stay- we brought our infant son and dog and it was much nicer than staying in a hotel. The location is great- just two blocks from Warren street where many restaurants, bars, and shops are. I am looking forward to coming back and renting the upstairs unit as well and bringing more people.

Wonderful apartment, very spacious, comfortable, private. For a couple (like us), we could not have asked for more. Well-furnished, stocked with basic kitchenware. Also a great backyard space, perfect for hosting and bbq-ing. Would also accommodate 3-4.

Hudson is quiet, but with a real community, very scenic. Great for escaping the constant bang-bang of NYC. We stayed 4 nights. Easy access by Amtrak. Great bars and restaurants; we went to Daba, (pm), and Half-moon, and recommend all--especially (pm) and Half-moon.

Thanks again, Claudia!

The kitchen was stocked with mugs and wine glasses, some coffee (and milk in the fridge!) and cooking utensils. The bathroom had soft large towels and quality wash cloths.

Though we didn't use it, the dining room is perfect if you are having a small dinner. Mostly - this apartment affords you space and peace of mind!

Everything was easy concerning the rental and I can't wait to get back to Hudson again. I would highly recommend this rental.

review_text:
Amazing apartment for a wedding in Catleton-on-Hudson. I stayed for a weekend with my girlfriend, and couldn't have asked for a better place.

When we approached, we thought we may have gotten lost, because the neighborhood is very downtrodden, with lots of boarded up windows and evicted houses. However, once we opened the apartment door, we were both shocked at the size and quality of the apartment. It's decorated with lots of new-englandy antiques, with art on the walls of the three large rooms, and a big, comfortable, bed.

Also, the location is pretty great despite the struggling neighborhood. The apartment is just a few blocks from Hudson's main street with a long stretch of antique stores, restaurants, and small local stores. It's also a short walk to an amazing restaurant opened by the owners of Fatty Crab in New York called Fish and Game.

Thanks for a great place!

Some might find being smack in the middle of a cemetery a bit morbid, but the neighbors are very quiet and it really is a tranquil setting. Plus, there's lots of history in the cemetery itself. The loft looked exactly like the pictures, was clean, quirky, comfortable, eclectic, and radiated a positive energy. Laura Ann was extremely responsive, graciously picked me up at the train station (along with her cockatiel), and provided many eating and shopping recommendations that all proved excellent (PLEASE go to Lil Deb's!). I wouldn't mind returning for my next stay up the river.

Some of the most unique furniture I’ve seen! Don’t let the whole being inside a cemetery thing turn you away nothing about the location felt unsettling or off and the location into town is the perfect distance for some privacy while still being able to walk to Warren Street. Laura Ann is an amazing host who responds very quickly with suggestions and recommendations. She even left a little pastry outside the door every day so we had a bite to eat before going off in the morning! The kitchen is stocked with all sorts of kitchen gadgets that cooking any great meal is possible. A very memorable and must stay if you’re spending a romantic or special weekend in Hudson!

review_text: Laura Ann's place is incredible - such a cool experience to be in a one of a kind loft in an old school house that is nestled between cemeteries. It's quiet, interesting and I loved the unique, artistic touches in the room. What makes the booking extra special is Laura Ann and her hosting. She was communicative and helpful from the start and even was able to pick me up and drop me off from the train station, which I sincerely appreciated it. She gave me plenty of recommendations and there are notes and thoughtful touches all in the room and at the property. The birds are also super sweet and social! The walk from the Warren strip to her place is relatively quick and quiet and you can see so many stars at night. 10/10 would return again!

name: Marcia
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a sweet place Laura Ann has here! We liked being in the middle of a cemetery, and we really liked the space inside our unit. Laura Ann has a quirky and inspiring decorating sense. She is also a true conservationist: the only paper you'll find there is TP (and no kitchen towels that we could find); there are kind notes to avoid overusing water and she keeps a tight lid on heat usage. These are things we do at our own home and I was impressed that she carries these important practices into her business.
We met only one of Laura Ann's two cockatoos - Poppy (Popcorn) which was a real treat. The antique Chinese bedstead, while beautiful to look at, is not super comfortable but it was okay for us for a few days; it's also a double size so tall people and wide people may not be comfortable. Hudson is a fun city with what seem lots of new shops and restaurants occupying lovely old buildings.

You’ll sleep on a cloud in her opium bed, but check out its intricate carvings in the daylight. Finally, the town itself is super cute, and you can find plenty to do. We loved the pastries left for us at the door the morning after! A must stay, and highly recommended. Thank you for this invigorating retreat!

review_text:
Laura Ann'e place is exactly as she describes.
It is of course sitting right in the middle of a cemetery, about 0.5 miles from the main part of town. Despite being out of town for most of our visit, LA was very attentive to our needs and requests for local recommendations.
The Mad Hatter is in the basement and is acceptable but not luxurious. The Asian Room upstairs is much more spacious and comfortable, quite special.
Many thanks.

Stayed one night
review_text: Laura Ann is an absolute treasure! She was quick to respond to any questions we had. Incredibly accommodating with our *much* later than expected arrival time. Gave us all kinds of lovely recommendations. Left us fresh strawberries and pastries for the morning. Shared her 3 absolutely fabulous cockatoos with us...we admittedly fell a bit in love with our new feathered friends. The Asia room was spectacular--so funky and fun, we loved every ounce of the vibe and feel. The only thing we'll think about for next time is maybe adding a couple extra blankets on top of the opium bed mattress...it's quite firm ;) We could go on and on about our stay...the setting was also brilliant. The walk into town is an easy and fun stroll, and the town itself is as charming as they come. We cannot wait to go back! Hoping to bring a handful of our friends along to enjoy the 3 other fab spaces Laura Ann has on offer. 110% will be back!

A quick drive into town (it was cold when we stayed, so we decided not to walk, though it’s not far at all), the location in the old civil war cemetery is cool and has plenty of parking. The antique bed is the centerpiece and is lovely and actually quite comfortable.

Just a truly phenomenal space and a somehow even more phenomenal host (and cohost bird friend).
As is common with unique spaces, the pictures shown hardly do justice to the purely magical experience of being in the home nor the glory of it’s location; a free standing tower overseeing a beautiful cemetery on all sides. A lovely short walk to town as well.
Though your privacy is absolutely respected, Laura Ann’s ecstatic spirit and artistic vision are present across the building, and we couldn’t be more excited to return to sample the other rooms to take more of it in when we return. We were honored with a peak at one room in the works, that when complete, will surely cement this spot’s reputation as Hudson’s own little Madonna Inn.

I highly recommend this place out of all the Airbnbs in Columbia county :)

This was our second stay in the loft and it was even better than our first visit. Laura greeted and checked us in upon arrival. She has such a warm, welcoming energy which immediately makes you feel comfortable and welcomed. The loft was impeccably clean and just how we had remembered it from our first stay. All necessities were left for us which is always an added bonus. The delicious treats Laura left both mornings at our door to have with our morning coffee were beyond thoughtful. The space is so amazing and enjoyable to relax in that we stayed in both evenings and enjoyed some dinner and cocktails. Everything was just perfect with our visit. Thank you again Laura for your amazing hospitality, and we shall visit again once the warm weather approaches! We’re already looking forward to it.
Gerard and Victor

We slept really well, and the bathroom was nice and clean. Central Hudson is indeed walkable, but you can also take a 5 minute Uber or taxi ride. I would recommend Laura Ann's place to anyone.

The Room is big. High ceilings, bright with an amazing view down the hill. Laura Ann is a very gracious host, giving us all the information we needed for our stay and leaving us to explore to our hearts content. Warren Street is a short walk from the building, and is packed with great restaurants, antique stores, and galleries. When we got back to Laura Ann's after our day out, we discovered she had left muffins out for us for the next morning. We will be booking again!

My boyfriend and I wanted to get out of NYC for a couple of days and we're so glad we found this spot! Reasonably priced for such a luxurious room. The bed is beautiful and set in a gorgeously decorated room.
Laura Ann was out of town, but one of the residents in the house picked us up from the train station, and even let us drop off our bags and drove us to the top of Warren so we could get brunch!
The end of Warren is pretty close, but Warren is a long stretch, so it could take you like 30-45 mins to walk the whole street (without stopping) - but my boyfriend and I enjoyed the walk and looking at the shops. We LOVE cemeteries, so it was such a cool location, being inside a cemetery. We took so many photos!
Thanks so much for hosting us!

My partner and I had an AMAZING stay! Everything was perfect. The room was very homey and comfortable. The cemetery part was a little weird but it did not hinder our stay in any way.
The bed was really pretty and vintage. Wasn't sure if my partner and I would fit properly, me being 5'10" and him being 6'1", but it was very comfortable (slept like babies). The commute to town was short, less than a 10 minute drive and the vintage shops were my favorite place to be. The food was great; as an artist, it was an overall wonderful place to be. Small town, friendly people, even made good friends. Definitely coming back for another stay. Awesome, aeesome, awesome!

review_text:
Really fantastic vibe. In the middle of a cemetery, and a 5 minute drive into downtown. My girlfriend and I slept in the futon bed just fine. Normally we sleep in a queen size bed, and typically like having a larger bed so we can each have our own space. So we were a little bit concerned that it would be too small. It really wasn't! I'm 5'10", we're both pretty fit people and we slept just fine.
We also made use of the refrigerator, stove, microwave, and most everything else in the kitchen for a couple of our meals. Everything worked great.
We're definitely hoping to revisit sometime!

Laura Ann is an absolutely delightful host: friendly, helpful, quick to respond, everything that you hope for in an Airbnb host. The building and this particular room are fun, funky, quite comfortable, well appointed, completely interesting spaces that make you smile and engage all your senses, making for a completely enjoyable stay.

The space was exactly as pictured; plenty of light, plenty of space and a total cocoon-like bed. We loved every second of being snowed in Saturday AM, and once the roads were cleared it was a 2 minute drive into a town FULL of restaurants, antique shops and galleries. It was perfect! HIGHLY recommended space and host!

I'd go back just to hang with Tiko some more, but also the place had a perfect vibe, was immaculate, and the decor details were really special. Great for a writer's retreat space, or romantic weekend. Staying in a graveyard was surreal and added a layer of quiet peacefulness. I will definitely be back!

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
My wife and I LOVED staying here! The space is fantastic and incredibly unique, and Laura Ann is the BEST host.

First, the place is like a loft, with super high ceilings and industrial features, yet warm and inviting thanks to the exotic decor, great lighting, and bright colors. The Chinese wedding bed was brilliant - I wouldn't have thought it possible, but I'm 6'3" and my wife and I slept in there well. And the bathroom and kitchen were clean and modern (which I love).

Second, Laurie was unbelievably welcoming and hospitable - she was funny, sweet, and diligent, and even offered us rides to/from the station.

The location is unusual, but is only 10-15 mins walk to town, and it helps keep things quiet and serene - not creepy at all, particularly since it's an active cemetery despite being old (e.g. families visiting loved ones, etc).

review_text: My recent stay in the Asian Room in the Cemetery was my first Airbnb experience. I like unique and this lovely space is truly that! Laura Ann and Rob were perfect hosts. I was especially impressed with the communication before and after our stay. Thank you! We will be back and next time we will stay longer and explore more. Laura Ann … your art is powerfully provocative and evocative. I’m sorry we didn’t meet this time around.

review_text: Laura was a fantastic host. She went out of her way to pick us up at the Amtrak station and drop us off. Sweet as can be. The room was describe accurately. The decor was beautiful. Lots of sunlight during the morning without it being overbearing. We were able to sleep in just fine. Very charming location to spend a weekend. The town of Hudson was great. Felt secure at all times of the day, even at night despite the cemetery. Definitely the best Airbnb experience so far!

name: Eve
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2016
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our host, Laura Ann, was just terrific --- warm, welcoming, and always wanting to help us. We even had Chinese food in her loft (with the cockatoos) and watched the second presidential debates together.

We just LOVED being in this loft --- very good for concentration (great long table), fantastic fun bed, very artistic, very large. Every little detail was great-- even cake under glass left at our door. It was a fun experience and we brought chinese robes to add to it! The cemetery is beautiful and it is peaceful to be in such a quiet place-- really silent, but not at all scary. We came without a car. The walk to Warren Street is easy and you can take a shortcut through the cemetery. We would definitely return! This is a great place to stay even longer, to bring books or to write. I think it would be great in any season.
Every amenity is thought out and thoughtful, down to the pile of books left to read in the reading corner. There are nice soaps, nice shampoo --- you can see that everything is done with great care. I actually wouldn't mind going there for a month just to relax and escape from NY City.

rating_info:

review_text: This was by far the best Airbnb I've ever stayed in. Laura Ann was kind enough to pick us up from the Amtrak station, she showed us around town, and she left a delicious breakfast treat outside our door each morning. She was present and available but not overbearing at all. The pictures don't do the space justice -- I would absolutely come here again. Amazing!

rating_info:

review_text: Laura Ann was very welcoming and her place is fantastic. ARTESTATE is an old public school transformed into art studio / gallery and guest apartments. A really original experience that can't be had with just a regular apartment rental. It was exactly as shown in the pictures - very comfortable and inspiring. This is Hudson!

name: Christine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

September 2016
,

Stayed one night
review_text:
One of our best Airbnb experiences ever! Laura was a perfect host! On our arrival she greeted us as if we were old friends, and we were made to feel right at home! She took us to our room, showed us around, and introduced us to tiko, her pet cockatoo, who made himself right at home on my husbands shoulder!!
The space is one in a million! The room was even more beautiful in person. It is filled with some of the most beautiful furniture I've ever seen, as well as some beautiful art pieces created by our wonderfully talented host. You can just tell how much love and care went into making this a very unique and tranquil space. laura is very accessible should you need anything. She responds within minutes and will also check with you to make sure you have everything you need.

The schoolhouse is perfectly located... Walking distance to warren street for cool shops and great food. Places of interest, hiking, etc are all just a very short drive.

The only thing lacking for us was time - We only stayed one night. We do hope to come back again soon to truly enjoy all that this great town has to offer!!

Laurie also went out of her way to make sure we got to and from her place and she even took the time to help us find somewhere to eat when almost everything was closed on the holiday weekend.

review_text: The room surpassed our expectations. It was spacious, bright, and thoughtfully laid out with some of the most interesting furniture we've ever seen. The location in the cemetery allowed for some privacy without moving us too far away from the downtown area. Laura Ann was a welcoming host who not only picked us up from the train station, but also left breakfast outside of our room every morning. We recommend this Air BnB to anyone looking for the luxuries of a fully functional suite combined with an eclectic experience you would not receive at a hotel.

name: Gerard
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2016
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had an absolutely spectacular time during our stay this weekend in Laura's loft. The loft itself was absolutely gorgeous. It was beautiful, spacious, and extremely clean. The furniture and art work are one of a kind, making the loft feel that much more special and intimate. The pictures of the listing are exactly as shown. It is even more impressive in person. Upon arrival, the facade of the building is so inviting, instantly making you feel like you've stepped back in time. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Laura and Tiko who we instantly felt comfortable with. The building itself is stunning with artwork covering the walls and work done by Laura herself. Laura was extremely informative giving us a tour of the loft, and letting us know where things were for our use. She was also extremely quick in her communication with us. She was a quick email away if and when we had a question. We had all of the amenities one could ask for during a short weekend getaway. The view of the cemetery from the loft is beyond calming, with a staircase to stand outside and relax on with a morning cup of coffee. The AC unit worked beautifully as well, and the bed was beyond comfortable. We slept like babies. In the event we became warm, Laura also provided us with a fan to help cool down the space. The two mornings we woke up in the loft, we were left with a morning surprise; coffee cake on a plate left by Laura. How thoughtful of her. It's the little details that make it worth the trip. Our checkout was effortless and we cannot wait to come back and visit. The listing is a short walk to town where there were so many wonderful antique shops and restaurants. Our trip and stay in Laura's loft was truly one of a kind that we were sad to leave. We cannot wait to return for another weekend. Thank you Laura for being such a wonderful, warm, and inviting host.

We enjoyed the room so much that (unfortunately) we didn't even take time to explore the cemetery. We will definitely be back! Book this room (and these people (and birds))!!

name: Cheryl
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: There’s no denying this is a beautiful Airbnb. There are a few honest things I wish I had known before booking so I’ll lay them out for you now. 1. Noise. Lots of it. Between the street noise & the person occupying the space above you and pounding their feet on the floor into the wee hours. If you like your sleep, do not stay here. 2. Parking. It is NOT free. It is metered Monday-Saturday for 50 cents an hour- max is 2 hours. So if you’re driving in, plan to run back to your car to feed the meter all day.Overnight parking requires an alternate system. I didn’t even know what that was and had to look it up 3.Semi-pet friendly. I booked this place so I could bring my pug, and learned a few days before the trip they have a rule about no pets on the bed. That’s not happening with a pug. So I didn’t bring him. 4. Transparency. I wish I had known these things before booking. If you’re a city dweller who can take the train in you’ll be fine. If you’re used to the quiet, maybe rethink this one

review_text: This stay was beautiful, the apartment was well furnished and in a great location. The only thing I wasn't totally happy about was the cleanliness of the apartment. I'm not sure if it just didn't get cleaned as thoroughly as it usually does, but I found dirty dishes out when I arrived. I also found hair that didn't belong to my guest or I in the bathroom and shower. Additionally, my dog found some food on the floor that was under a chair. Maybe it was a fluke since many of the previous reviews are about how clean it is. Other than that, I really enjoyed staying here and would come back again.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Super cute apartment in a great spot on the main street of Hudson - all the restaurants, bars, and shops are within walking distance, and the apartment itself was super clean and well decorated. Only 2 small complaints: one is there isn’t free parking like the listing says. Zach does a great job explaining the confusing parking in Hudson, but there’s no designated parking space and you’ll still have to park on the street and move your car all the time to avoid tickets. The other complaint is that the building itself is pretty old, and as such there’s lots of noise - both from the unit above and from the busy street outside. Not a huge issue, but do be warned that it can be pretty loud on Friday/Saturday nights as people walk up and down Warren street from the bars. But other than that the apartment was great! Definitely a great place if you’re looking to stay in Hudson.

,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
In hindsight, I was the worst guest you could imagine. I misread something and let it effect my mood and attitude. I owe a huge apology to our hosts!
This is a fabulous place to stay in “uptown" Hudson. It’s close to the Hudson River and the train station. It’s in the midst of the arts and antiques businesses on Warren Street.
We love dining at Feast and Floret and found ourselves there once again. We loved being so close having had a few drinks with dinner.
Our hosts were kind enough to open our door when I confused the access code arriving home. They are an amazing young couple with excellent taste in interior design and outfitting the perfect apartment.
I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the street noise was in the morning. I expected to be woken up early by cars/trucks. We slept until 9am!! It was great!
Did I mention the shower? Best ever...
This is a delightful apartment and the hosts couldn’t be better! We highly recommend you stay here!

name: Jenny Anna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would.
The space is so well thought out, charming, spacious, and comfortable. I did feel like I was transported to Paris, with the tall windows and beautiful light. Felt very comfortable and safe in this apartment alone. The updated restroom and kitchen are wonderful. The shower is just enough pressure and gets pretty hot. The bed is comfortable, and I used the daybed in the smaller room to drink my morning tea, and read and write. The decor was perfect, I’m obsessed with the giant mirror! The tv mounted in front of the bed, but covetable was also nice touch.
For the space, I recommend 2 adults max, and 1 child potentially. The bed is big enough for two adults. The smaller room has a day bed that can easily sleep a child maybe below 7-8 years old if they aren’t too tall. Otherwise I used the room as my office and hang area.
The location was superb. It’s by some great shops and cafes and nothing is too far of a walk. It’s just one flight of stairs on a walk up. I walked everyday I was there, and when I couldn’t get a car to take me back to the Amtrak, I ended up walking all the way there. About 20-25 min straight shot, not bad.
The host Zachary was so easy to communicate with, and courteous, and really did not need to contact them much. The doors are automated making the entry easy to come and go.
This is probably one of the best airbnbs I’ve ever stayed at.

A few things to be mindful of... There is a long narrow staircase to walk up to, so those with a big suitcase would have a bit of trouble carrying the luggage up. Also, the apartment is located in a popular area, so while it's easy to navigate around the town, it's a bit noisy early in the morning and sometimes at night due to cars driving by.

The description in the copy is clear that this is not the place to stay if you want to cook. There is a small fridge, microwave, and coffee pot, but the only sink is in the bathroom. Also note--if you have a different sleep schedule than your partner-- that the TV is in the bedroom.

review_text: We enjoyed our stay! Nice spot, easy parking, and right off the primary walking area in Hudson. Bed is comfy. Place feels secure. We were here in early spring, place was nice and warm - the radiant heat in the floor is utterly delightful! The place was super-clean and fresh. In response to other reviewers, I brought a dishpan but the bathroom sink, while small, was serviceable for washing out cups and plates. The two steep stairs down to enter were not a problem for us but if you badly need a new hip or knee, you might find that rough. Had some delightful meals in Hudson and nearby Rheinbeck. great recommendations from the host. Great experience.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This little gem was the perfect pad from which to explore downtown Hudson. The (very comfortable) queen bed plus day bed were a great setup for my husband, our toddler, and me. The place is super cute and the back patio is a nice feature. Nancy accommodated our request to drop off our suitcase a few hours before checkin, as we arrived in town before lunchtime via train, which was much appreciated. As Nancy says in the listing, this place lacks a full kitchen, but we didn’t miss it because we were so close to great restaurants and coffee shops. We would stay here again!

name: Joshua
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Overall, it was ok. Things to know before you go: There are no places to hang clothes, and they're were no hangers for our stay (though I'm right there's usually...one). Made it hard to iron or steam suits and dresses for the wedding we attended, because we had nowhere to put the clothes to dry or keep from wrinkling. You will need to run dehumidifiers at all hours and empty the collectors every day; these dehumidifiers emit lots of heat, so the room is toasty at all times--great unless you want to go to sleep. We needed to keep the patio doors open and have them battle the dehumidifiers to keep temps lower. Then mosquitos came. There's a low rack in the bathroom for toiletries, but basically no sink space (couldn't even balance their cups on the sink). Bed is extremely springy, such that any movement will jiggle the entire thing. Watch your hands on the second (of three!) doors into the unit because it's so close to the doorframe that it will cut your finger if you aren't careful.

name: Megan
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is an attractive basement walkout, nicely decorated and equipped in a great location - walkable to great restaurants and breweries and in reach of so much of interest in the area.
Because it’s a basement, dehumidifiers run 24/7 and heat up the place. There’s an air conditioner but it struggles to keep up with the heat output. Together they create considerable ambient noise, which people who sleep with fans will appreciate. Probably very cozy in winter!
You climb a set of stairs to get the key and then down that set and another short set of stairs accesses the unit’s entrance. The vestibule has a stone that doesn’t completely fill the dirt floor and makes for tricky footing while you’re loading in. None of this presented a serious issue for us since we’re agile.

review_text: Perfect location, a great place for a 1-2 night stay. However, there were two bulky pieces of equipment (one a dehumidifier and the other an AC unit) that were not shown in the photos in the listing -- and we did not learn about the dehumidifier until we received our check-in instructions. Unfortunately the AC was in a room separated by a partial wall so it did not cool the whole place down effectively. Our biggest complaint was that it was warm but little could have been done about it given where the AC unit was located. Even though it wasn't as light and bright as the photos on the listing -- and the dehumidifier and AC were also not shown in the photos (which was misleading) overall the space was cozy and cute. And again... can't beat the location!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Three stars because it is a very cute basement apartment with incredible built ins, very clean, and a short 2 minute walk to Warren street with great restaurants and shops. However I visited with my elderly mother and dog and being that we both have Asthma, I wish we would have known the apartment smelled of mold and was equipped with 2 large dehumidifier’s which each needed to be emptied twice a day. They are not shown in photos or mentioned and I wish we would have known this beforehand as we had reactions, coughing and allergies and had not planned on this added maintenance for clean air. Additionally there is a sound sensor and camera at the airbnbs door, when it’s opened you can hear it activate on a higher floor of the home alerting the host of our coming and going. I’ve never experienced this type of monitoring from a host, it made us uncomfortable, we felt like we were being watched and there was no mention of this beforehand.

We were able to use the chairs to lay out our wedding attire but there were plenty of towels and the beds were comfortable. The daybed in the living room does squeak when you move in it but was very nice to sleep in. If someone is staying in the unit above you will hear them. Luckily our upstairs neighbors were very courteous and we didn't hear anything late at night. Lovely park across the street and very walkable to any restaurants on Warren Street.

review_text:
We were in Hudson for the long weekend surrounding the NYState sheep & wool festival in rhinebeck. Hudson was abt a 20 min drive and wonderful in that it’s not overcrowded with festival attendees.
Jenny’s place is well-appointed and comfortable. It’s also restful and we really enjoyed our time there.
A bonus for us was Billie Holiday (a small white dog) who lived next door. We just lost our small white pupper Phil, and Saturday morning during our stay, I heard some small footsteps on the back deck. When I looked out the back window, YAY! The Puppy Distribution System was in full force and we got to spend some quality time with Billie. Well, maybe only 5 minutes, but for us, terribly missing our dog, it was wonderful. Thank you Billie’s human, Jenny and Billie Holiday herself for some very welcome wiggles and pets.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A very cool and comfortable space in an area of Hudson where you can walk out in any direction and find something interesting. Hudson is awash in 19thC architecture and there are many streets that are just stunning.
The apartment is on a street that comes close to having the most traffic, on foot and by car, in the downtown Hudson area. The layout of the apartment and plantings in front provide a decent setback and ample quiet inside.
The apartment itself was very well appointed, all the entry and checkout instructions were clear and simple. There are books and online info on local food and sights. Jenny was incredibly welcoming, thoughtful and responsive to us on a number of levels. Take her advice on restaurants and you will be SO happy you did!

name: Elvis
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

July 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
*Wonderful, highly recommend!* This is an excellent location (on the main strip of Hudson, Warren Street), but also nice and quiet with an additional backyard area/patio.
The apartment is extremely spruce + clean, the beds are highly comfortable, and shower is great. Above all, the hosts are extremely kind people and super responsive about all aspects. This is the rare Airbnb where you feel a cozy sense of the person's home, and also excels in all areas of amenities one might want for a stay in Hudson.
There is AC in the two bedrooms which kept us nice and cool. The kitchen is well stocked, we were able to cook whole meals and there are delis/groceries nearby.
We would definitely stay here again (if amenable to the kind hosts), as it was very easy walking distance from both the Amtrak train station, shops + restaurants. Perfect for a family or couple.
Lastly, the friendly yellow door makes this place easy to spot, and is a great symbol of the cozy + high standards here.

review_text: What a fabulous stay! Jenny is lovely and so is this apartment, which could not be more convenient to everything Hudson has to offer. Fabulous cafes and shops are just down the street in either direction but it somehow feels calm because the bedroom and back patio are away from the street and the house is already set back itself. Lots of free on-street parking too, and the kitchen is very well provisioned. The only thing we’d note is that the second bedroom is really small, so much so that it would be hard to close the door (we used it for storage). But for the two of us, it was the perfect base for a week-plus Hudson Valley vacation.

review_text:
We checked out of Jenny’s this morning and I have to say, our experience at her place was one of our favorite Airbnb stays thus far.
First of all, we lovvvved the aesthetics of the apartment, from the tasteful art on the walls to the eclectic dinnerware, to the great books on the shelves. Jenny has the decorating Midas touch! Great energy throughout.
Secondly, the beds were very comfortable, the bath towels soft, and had a great back patio for morning Joe. All the extra touches meant a lot to us. Fresh coffee beans. A new tube of toothpaste and extra toothbrushes (hubs forgot his paste, daughter forgot toothbrush) in the bathroom medicine cabinet.
We were walking distance to everything we needed. Great restaurants, great shops, great coffee. Being a California girl, I loved the little organic nonprofit, Rolling Grocer, half a block away.
Jenny was super responsive and super cool. Next time I’m in Hudson, I sure hope her place is available. It was a comfortable, sensory sanctuary.
Thank you Jenny!
Goldie&Chris

Jenny was a great host. Welcomed me when I got in and kept up quick communication. I accidentally left behind some toiletries & medication -- and she helped make sure that they got back to me. 5 out 5 stars.

review_text:
This was my second visit to Hudson and staying at Jenny’s lovely cottage made it an amazing and unforgettable trip. I came here to work on a creative project (and my day job) and was able to get all of the things done that I wanted to because I was able to relax in this lovely environment.
The colors in the space along with the eclectic collection of books and pieces of artwork around the home made it really fun. Every day I was discovering something else that was interesting like books on decorating or a lovely wood curtain rod in one of the bedrooms. Don’t get me started on the shower. The rainforest showerhead is a dream and the selection of lovely soaps and body washes were a really nice touch and very thoughtful.
A friend joined me for the latter portion of the visit and she loved it as well. We both will be back. Jenny is an amazing host and Kent is as well. I had a few minor issues and they both were super responsive and helped to alleviate things quickly.
Last but not least, Jenny’s place is in close proximity to so many cool restaurants and art galleries and other sites to see!
This was one of the most fun and relaxing work trips I’ve ever had! I highly recommend this stay!
Thanks, Jenny and Kent!

review_text: This is just the perfect place to stay when visiting Hudson. It's a few minutes walk from the train. Then the apartment is centrally located to everything. As for the apartment itself, it was wonderful! Bright colorful eclectic design which is so perfect for a place like Hudson that's filled with art, history and antiques. The bed and the sheets were phenomenal. The shower head was the size of a plate and also amazing. It had a cute outdoor patio that was wonderful for writing and dreaming. Clean, sunny, easy to cook in the kitchen if thats what you enjoy. And, of course, there's Jenny. So warm and helpful and responsive. I can't recommend this place enough.

name: Laurie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed over a week
review_text:
Just left a GLORIOUS month at Jenny’s. I lived and worked from her apartment in Hudson as I explored a move upstate. Comfort was key, and so was a place to feel inspired and uplifted while cranking out work.
Her home was everything I hoped for and more! A jewel box of a place. Ultra comfortable beds and linens, the dreamiest shower, beautiful, thoughtful original design and custom-built specialness throughout. Hand-picked delights everywhere (art and photography, that book collection, swoon, yes those cool and very functional hooks). There’s a fab little kitchen with a gorgeous stove for cooking outfitted with all the basics plus, should you choose to stay in. La Perche, Verdigris, Moto coffee, Maker Hotel just steps away make it easy to explore great local food. This is a special part of Warren Street, quiet, bright and cheerful.
Amazing! Could not recommend it more highly.
Creating a home and hosting is clearly a labor of love for Jenny. She’s a wonderful person. A complete and utter joy to stay with: lovely, thoughtful, responsive and warm.
I’ll be back soon. Come stay here! You’ll love it.

name: Kent
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2018
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I booked Jenny’s place for a quick midweek stay, and it is utterly adorable! The photos only hint at what a sweet place it is. It's charming and stylish, with so many touches that make it feel like a home away from home, only nicer.
There are thoughtful touches everywhere—great books to look at, art by local artists on the walls, cool and lovely furniture, beautifully finished knotty pine floors, fresh paint, a cute, well-laid out kitchen with everything you might need, all clean lines and bright colors. The back door opens out onto a new deck that is perfect for morning coffee. The two bedrooms are cozy and the was amazingly comfortable. The blackout shades were great, and the AC kept the apartment really cool. The bathroom is beautifully tiled and has a sleek curbless shower, marble counter and frosted windows. The shower has amazing locally made organic body wash, shampoo and conditioner, and the shower head is like standing under a waterfall!
Jenny is a cheerful and totally accessible host—even though she’s in Brooklyn she wanted to make sure I got checked in with no hassle, and is ready with great recommendations for the many cool places to walk to—restaurants, stores, boutiques. I loved Cafe Le Perche just a few doors down, and Wm. Farmer and Sons, which is a five minute stroll from the house.
Great stay, great place, great host. Hudson is a gem of a city and this is a gem of an airbnb, and I plan to stay here whenever I visit!

review_text: I have stayed in many Airbnbs and they rarely feel like hotels. This felt like a hotel, but also like a home! The bedding was so soft and cozy; the decor was fun and mod, but live-able mod, not too dramatic. There good books to read, a quality tv, ac units, and a fully stocked kitchen. And a rain shower in the bathroom! Literally, everything was available and more. There were so many little touches that made this feel really like a special stay. I was able to meet Jenny as we head out and she's just as lovely as the apartment! Also location can't be beat -- you can walk from Amtrak and walk all over town and have a totally car-free experience quite easily. We will be back!
